intro: Senecio rudbeckiifolius, commonly known as the roughleaf senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy, rough-textured leaves that are typically lance-shaped and have a distinctive blue-green hue. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Senecio rudbeckiifolius is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and drought tolerance.
